author: Special Correspondent
text:
Wiring work is being done in ward 213, the intensive surgical care unit at Rajiv Gandhi Government General Hospital, where a minor fire broke out on Monday.

Medical superintendent of the hospital G. Sheelarani said, “We are changing the wiring so that the electricity and oxygen lines are separated. The Public Works Department will complete the work by Wednesday.” She said the hospital planned to have the wiring in other ICUs checked.

She added that whitewashing of the ward had been completed, and once the wiring work was done, the ward would be cleaned and patients moved in. Of the 16 patients who were evacuated early on Monday and shifted to other wards, three died due to complications from their illnesses on Monday, hospital authorities said. Dr. Sheelarani said that of the remaining 13, two were critical, while the others were stable.

Minor fire broke out at the intensive surgical care unit at Rajiv Gandhi Government General Hospital
title: Wiring work on at Chennai Govt. Hospital ward
